subject: Design
title: Siri and the Voice Revolution: Talking to Machines
description: A quick win: understand Siri and the Voice Revolution: Talking to Machines.

hook.text: When Apple launched Siri in 2011, people asked it the meaning of life. It was the first mass voice UI.

buildup.text: Voice interfaces use natural language processing to interpret spoken commands and respond conversationally.

discovery.text: By 2023, over 4 billion voice assistants were active worldwide â€” more than the number of smartphones.

twist.text: Voice UIs fail silently. Unlike screens, there's no visual feedback for errors. Users just feel confused.

climax.text: Voice shifted interfaces from visual to conversational â€” requiring entirely new design principles.

punchline.text: The newest interface is the oldest one: human conversation.

quiz.question: What unique challenge do voice interfaces present compared to screens?
options: No visual feedback for errors, causing silent failures
